items.title: webbrowser does not show up when running as root
items.body:
I'm running on linux , and `ztoken token ...` does not open web-browser when running from root terminal as it has no connection to my `xhost` 
https://forums.opensuse.org/showthread.php/488901-Python-webbrowser-with-root

items.title: Breaks if called concurrently more than twice
items.body:
Calling the script more than twice concurrently breaks the credential caching behaviour.

To reproduce:
```
ztoken & ; ztoken & ; ztoken &
```

I've come across this by trying to call `ztoken` from my concurrent service locally. I'm thinking this could be fixed by a having the script use a lock file to prevent itself from running more than once concurrently.

items.title: No OAuth 2 token endpoint option in ztoken
items.body:
There is no option available for specifying a different token endpoint, only the authorization endpoint. 

```bash
rreis@tesseract:~/go/src/github.bus.zalan.do/rreis/dcskipper$ ztoken token --help
Usage: ztoken token [OPTIONS]

  Create a new Platform IAM token or use an existing one.

Options:
  -n, --name TOKEN_NAME           Custom token name (will be stored)
  -a, --authorize-url AUTH_URL    OAuth 2 Authorization Endpoint URL to
                                  generate access token
  -c, --client-id CLIENT_ID       Client ID to use
  -p, --business-partner-id PARTNER_ID
                                  Business Partner ID to use
  -r, --refresh                   Force refresh of the access token
  -h, --help                      Show this message and exit.
```

One usecase where this can be useful is in the Sandbox:

```bash
ztoken token -a https://sandbox.identity.zalando.com/oauth2/authorize -t https://sandbox.identity.zalando.com/oauth2/token
```

If only the authorize endpoint is overriden, ztoken still returns a token based on its current configuration, if it sill has a valid refresh token.

To avoid confusion, ztoken should behave:
- If `-a` is specified, ask **always** for the refresh token endpoint
- If `-t` is specified, ask **always** for the authorization endpoint
- When any of the previous options are used, **never** override the existing refresh token from the original configuration.

items.title: --refresh doesn't do anything useful
items.body:
The `--refresh` flag doesn't do anything for named tokens.

```
$ ztoken token --refresh -n postman | md5sum
34e6b2a7a14439271f077690eba31fa3  -
$ ztoken token --refresh -n postman | md5sum
34e6b2a7a14439271f077690eba31fa3  -
```

I expected this to request a new token using the existing refresh token.

Interestingly it also does weird things when requesting an unnamed token (`ztoken token --refresh`). Then a browser window is always opened and after successful authentication you get

```
{
"error": "invalid_client",
"error_description": "invalid client"
}
```

The reason for that seems to be wrong creation of the URL. It points to `.../oauth2/authorize?business_partner_id=True&client_id=ztoken&redirect_uri=http://localhost:8081&response_type=token` (True as business_partner_id).

---

There is also the general weirdness of different behavior of when new tokens are created. Creating an unnamed token just records the refresh token but not the token and no lifetime. This way every run of `ztoken` has to create a new token and so `--refresh` would be pointless there. Creating a named token records the lifetime and seems to return the same token every time as long as it is valid. Even if the `--refresh` thing were fixed, this dichotomy would not go away.

items.title: Change zign.api.get_token to use OAuth implicit flow
items.body:
Use the [OAuth implicit flow](https://github.com/zalando-stups/zign/blob/master/zign/api.py#L250) instead of calling the proprietary "Token Service". This will change the "backend" for all CLI tools using `zign.api.get_token`:

* https://github.com/zalando-stups/piu
* https://github.com/zalando-stups/pierone-cli
* https://github.com/zalando-stups/fullstop-cli
* https://github.com/zalando-zmon/zmon-cli

items.title: Existing port binding is not always respected when choosing a local port.
items.body:
How to reproduce:
On Mac, start a docker image that is bound to port 8081, e.g. `docker run -p 8081:5000 training/webapp python app.py` (I used Docker version 1.12.3).
Then run `python3 -m zign` and it will use port `8081` but Chrome (and Safari) resolves `http://localhost:8081` to the docker image.

It seems to be related to ipv4 and ipv6 since `http://[::1]:8081` goes to the docker image while `http://127.0.0.1:8081` goes to server spawned by zign.

items.title: Why do I see my name/account used for changing labels?
items.body: Hi guys, why do I see my username/account used to change labels for this project. I'm sure not doing anything on the 'zign'-repo. But I see my account to be used to change the labels. Has someone an idea why this happens? Do we use some other tools for issue handling here?

items.title: Process stuck in Firefox
items.body:
When doing `ztoken` and firefox set as default browser the process gets stuck and the HTML only shows **Redirecting**.

By the looks of it the include JavaScript does not extract the Token from the URL properly.

```url
http://localhost:8081/#access_token=....
```

in chrome its been casted to

```url 
http://localhost:8081/?access_token=
```

items.title: Wrong text on ERROR_PAGE
items.body: Error page says "You are now authenticated with Zign." --- obviously it should say that the authentication failed.

items.title: Remove oauth2client dependency
items.body:
We are only importing `tools` from `oauth2client` (https://github.com/zalando-stups/zign/blob/master/zign/api.py#L14) and the used classes are nearly completely overwritten by us.
The `oauth2client` package contains much more stuff we don't use.

Let's get rid of the whole dependency! We only need to add the server class as far as I can see.

items.title: Informational output should be written to stderr
items.body:
This does not work as expected as the output is cluttered with informational output:

```
tok=$(ztoken)
```

We need to print any debug/info messages to stderr, stdout should only contain the token.

items.title: "ztoken" fails for SSO
items.body:
`ztoken` will fail if OAuth provider uses SSO and directly redirects back to localhost:

Browser error (localhost server already shut down):
```
This site can’t be reached

localhost refused to connect.
```

items.title: Only return token if it's valid for at least 5 more minutes
items.body: Zign might return tokens which expire "just now", we should only return tokens if they are valid for at least 5 more minutes.

items.title: Transparently get service tokens via "tokens" library if possible
items.body: We already have the `zign.api.get_token` function and we should consider getting service tokens transparently also when using `zign token` directly.

items.title: CLI should use username from configuration file if set
items.body:
Only `zign.api.get_token` uses the "user" property from config right now, but CLI must honor it too.

See http://docs.stups.io/en/latest/components/zign.html#configuration

items.title: Add "keyrings.alt" dependency to make it work again regardless of platform
items.body:
Sadly the maintainer of "keyring" is convinced that the encrypted file backend (which works regardless of platform!) should not be in the core "keyring" module anymore, see https://github.com/jaraco/keyring/issues/196

So we need to add the "keyrings.alt" dependency in most of our CLI tools to ensure same user experience, otherwise users might get:

```
File "/foo/bar/lib/python3.5/site-packages/keyring/backends/fail.py", line 18, in get_password
    raise RuntimeError("No recommended backend was available")
RuntimeError: No recommended backend was available
```

items.title: Unable to autolaunch a dbus-daemon without a $DISPLAY for X11
items.body:
Apparently there is a bug in the latest version of the keyring python module, which is used by zign.
This leads to a problem, that in [Taupage](https://github.com/zalando-stups/taupage) during boot a script, which uses zign tries to open the dbus-daemon.

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./init.d/03-push-taupage-yaml.py", line 10, in <module>
    from taupage import configure_logging, get_config, mask_dictionary, get_token, get_boot_time
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.4/dist-packages/taupage/__init__.py", line 11, in <module>
    import zign.api
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.4/dist-packages/zign/api.py", line 3, in <module>
    import keyring
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.4/dist-packages/keyring/__init__.py", line 12, in <module>
    from .core import (set_keyring, get_keyring, set_password, get_password,
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.4/dist-packages/keyring/core.py", line 158, in <module>
    init_backend()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.4/dist-packages/keyring/core.py", line 58, in init_backend
    set_keyring(load_config() or _get_best_keyring())
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.4/dist-packages/keyring/core.py", line 66, in _get_best_keyring
    keyrings = backend.get_all_keyring()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.4/dist-packages/keyring/util/__init__.py", line 20, in wrapper
    func.always_returns = func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.4/dist-packages/keyring/backend.py", line 180, in get_all_keyring
    exceptions=TypeError))
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.4/dist-packages/keyring/util/__init__.py", line 29, in suppress_exceptions
    for callable in callables:
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.4/dist-packages/keyring/backend.py", line 172, in is_class_viable
    keyring_cls.priority
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.4/dist-packages/keyring/util/properties.py", line 22, in __get__
    return self.fget.__get__(None, owner)()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.4/dist-packages/keyring/util/XDG.py", line 18, in wrapper
    return func(*args, **kwargs) * self.multiplier
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.4/dist-packages/keyring/backends/kwallet.py", line 134, in priority
    bus = dbus.SessionBus()
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/dbus/_dbus.py", line 211, in __new__
    mainloop=mainloop)
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/dbus/_dbus.py", line 100, in __new__
    bus = BusConnection.__new__(subclass, bus_type, mainloop=mainloop)
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/dbus/bus.py", line 122, in __new__
    bus = cls._new_for_bus(address_or_type, mainloop=mainloop)
dbus.exceptions.DBusException: org.freedesktop.DBus.Error.NotSupported: Unable to autolaunch a dbus-daemon without a $DISPLAY for X11
```

items.title: Add simple API facade function to get an OAuth token "no matter how"
items.body:
```
access_token = zign.api.get_token('mytok', ['uid'])
```

items.title: Command option to allow user to change authentication-provider-url.
items.body:
After specifying the wrong authentication-provider-url I could'nt change the url again.
I had to remove the `zign.yaml` file created on my computer.
Can zign have a command option to set/overwrite current authentication-provider-url?
Something like `zign --set-url https://authentication-provider-url.com/oauth2`

items.title: Implement token invalidation
items.body: Our Token Service now supports invalidation, so Zign should, too!

items.title: delete didn't revoke token, delete remove only from the local storage
items.body:
zign delete should revoke the token, and not only remove from the local storage

```
------------------------------------------------------------
» zign token -n application-registry
e22c141b-7589-47ad-8eae-a574c95d3436
------------------------------------------------------------
» curl "https://example.example.com/oauth2/tokeninfo?access_token=e22c141b-7589-47ad-8eae-a574c95d3436"
{"access_token":"e22c141b-7589-47ad-8eae-a574c95d3436","uid":"tuxlife","grant_type":"passwor...
------------------------------------------------------------
» zign delete application-registry
------------------------------------------------------------
» curl "https://example.example.com/oauth2/tokeninfo?access_token=e22c141b-7589-47ad-8eae-a574c95d3436"
{"access_token":"e22c141b-7589-47ad-8eae-a574c95d3436","uid":"tuxlife","grant_type":"passwor...
------------------------------------------------------------
```

items.title: zign missing handling for wrong passwords
items.body:
Zign do not ask again for the password, if the password wrong

```
------------------------------------------------------------
[20150610 122621] ~ » zign token                                                           
Password: **wrongpw**
Usage: zign token [OPTIONS] [SCOPE]...

Error: {code: 401, message: 'ERROR sendRequest(): {"error_description":"The provided access
    grant is invalid, expired, or revoked.","error":"invalid_grant"}

    ', reason: Unauthorized}

------------------------------------------------------------
[20150610 122628] ~ » zign token
Usage: zign token [OPTIONS] [SCOPE]...

Error: {code: 401, message: 'ERROR sendRequest(): {"error_description":"The provided access
    grant is invalid, expired, or revoked.","error":"invalid_grant"}

    ', reason: Unauthorized}

------------------------------------------------------------
[20150610 122630] ~ » python3 -c "import keyring; keyring.delete_password('zign', 'mkerk')"
------------------------------------------------------------
[20150610 122634] ~ » zign token                                                           
Password: **rightpw**
f0fef60e-d824-4a43-be9a-5a92a6c03ca3
------------------------------------------------------------
[20150610 122644] ~ » zign token                                                           
9d208d95-b9ff-4ee2-966e-c8c2b74d2c88
------------------------------------------------------------
```

Please save the Password only, if the request successful and remove the Keyring-PW if it exists
